results.title: Discovering psychology
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A challenging series of programs on human psychology hosted by veteran psychology professor, Philip Zimbardo of Stanford University. New developments are measured against historical breakthroughs and theories are tested by the recent findings of leading researchers.
results.description: A challenging series of programs on human psychology hosted by veteran psychology professor, Philip Zimbardo of Stanford University. New developments are measured against historical breakthroughs and theories are tested by the recent findings of leading researchers.

results.title: Discovering perspective
results.creator_credit: Film Associates of California, Paul Burnford and Jerry Samuelson
results.brief_description: We live in a world of depth and distance, which is called perspective. In drawing or painting on a flat surface, there are several ways in which to create the appearance of perspective: by overlapping and the placement of objects and lines, use of color, making objects clear or indistinct, and varying the size of objects.

results.title: Discovering mood in music (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Through listening to various types of music the class discovers different ways that the composer has used to depict moods. Then they find that they can move in ways that reflect the moods of music and art.
results.description: Through listening to various types of music the class discovers different ways that the composer has used to depict moods. Then they find that they can move in ways that reflect the moods of music and art.

results.title: Discovering melody and harmony (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Illustrates the movement and relationship of melody and harmony in music. Harmony is added to the melody through the use of descant and thirds and by playing instruments showing how both can move in repeats, steps or skips.
results.description: Illustrates the movement and relationship of melody and harmony in music. Harmony is added to the melody through the use of descant and thirds and by playing instruments showing how both can move in repeats, steps or skips.

results.title: Discovering jazz (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Traces the history of jazz from its roots in nineteenth century black America. Rhythmic and melodic freedom were added to the harmony and structure of European music, and techniques like note bending, call and response were added. Jazz soon became popular and its form progressed from dixie and blues through such styles as swing, bop, cool jazz, funky and free improvisation.

results.title: Discovering individual differences
results.brief_description: The methods by which a fifth-grade teacher becomes acquainted with the individual needs and characteristics of the children in her class, displayed in dramatised incidents. Shows how these techniques are successfully applied in five typical cases and how they might be generally used to supplement the teacher’s own experience and resourcefulness.

results.title: Discovering harmony in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Productions
results.brief_description: Harmony is a pleasing agreement in the things we hear, see, or do. Many things are harmonious in the world of nature. Harmony in art can be achieved in various ways. Firstly by limiting the number of objects, colors and shapes we use; secondly, by repeating objects, colors and shapes; thirdly, by using related objects, colors and shapes.
results.description: Harmony is a pleasing agreement in the things we hear, see, or do. Many things are harmonious in the world of nature. Harmony in art can be achieved in various ways. results.title: Discovering electronic music (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Bernard Wilets
results.brief_description: Shows something of the physical basis of music and how it can be created and altered by electronic means. Demonstrates the sound synthesizer and its capacity to create, envelop and filter sound. Shows computer controlled music and a composition being created through the use of a computer.

results.title: Discovering democracy: stories of democracy (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: A comprehensive tour using print, audio, video and graphic sources through the history and basic features of democracy as a system in Australia and internationally. This CD-rom provides specifically designed pathways of directed information and interactive learning about people, events and policies in relation to the history and current manifestations of democracy. Suitable for middle and upper primary students, as well as lower and middle secondary levels. It also contains constant explanation of terms used and citations of the sources drawn from - for independent research.

results.title: Discovering creative pattern
results.brief_description: A visually interesting film that presents a range of both natural and man made patterns. Provides practical ideas for creating patterns.This video has some useful classroom teaching applications.
